identificationModule.briefTitle: A Study of Verutex (Fusidic Acid), Eritex (Erythromycin) and Fisiogel in the Management of Tarceva-Associated Rash.
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Randomized, Open Label Study to Compare the Use of the Dermatological Creams Verutex, Eritex and Fisiogel in the Management of Skin Rash Associated With Tarceva Treatment in Patients With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Non-small Cell Lung Cancer.

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This 3 arm study will compare the efficacy and safety of three different dermatological creams designed for prophylaxis of skin rash associated with Tarceva treatment in patients with locally advanced or metastatic non-small cell lung cancer. Eligible patients who have recently started Tarceva treatment will be randomized to one of 3 groups, to receive daily treatment with Verutex, Eritex or Fisiogel cream for 30 days, and the incidence and severity of skin rash will be assessed. The anticipated time on study treatment is \<3 months, and the target sample size is 100-500 individuals.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Develop Skin Rash
primaryOutcomes.description: Skin rash was assessed by the investigator and dermatologists (the latter ones only through pictures) and scored according to (National cancer Institute -Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events ) NCI-CTCAE ( version 3 (line "Rash/desquamation" - short name "rash").

primaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Participants With Skin Rash Stratified by Severity Grade
primaryOutcomes.description: The severity of skin rash was graded on a 5 point scale where 0 (equals)= absent, 1= mile, 2=moderate, 3= severe, 4= life threatening and 5= Death

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Time to Appearance of Skin Rash
secondaryOutcomes.description: Time to occurence of skin rash was calculated as the number of days from Day 0 until the first appearance of skin rash as defined by NCI-CTCAE
Erythema is defined as redness of the skin or mucous membranes, caused by hyperemia of superficial capillaries
Pruritus is defined as intense localized itching
Pain is defined as an unpleasant feeling often caused by intense or damaging stimuli

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Participants With Erythema Stratified by Severity Grade
secondaryOutcomes.description: The severity of skin rash was graded on a 5 point scale where 0 (equals)= absent, 1= mile, 2=moderate, 3= severe, 4= life threatening and 5= Death; Severity graded by oncologist.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Participants With Pruritus Stratified by Severity Grade
secondaryOutcomes.description: The severity of skin rash was graded on a 5 point scale where 0 (equals)= absent, 1= mile, 2=moderate, 3= severe, 4= life threatening and 5= Death; Severity graded by oncologist.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Participants With Pain Stratified by Severity Grade
secondaryOutcomes.description: The severity of pain was graded on a 5 point scale where 0 (equals)= absent, 1= mile, 2=moderate, 3= severe, 4= life threatening and 5= Death; Severity graded by oncologist.

groups.title: Fisiogel
groups.description: Participants received erlotinib 150 milligrams (mg) daily and A thin film of the topical formulation of Fisiogel was applied to face, neck, and anterior and posterior chest twice daily (every 12 hours), as per medical guidance daily for 30 days.

groups.title: Stiemicyn
groups.description: Participants received erlotinib 150 mg daily and a thin film of the topical formulation of Stiemicyn was applied to face, neck, and anterior and posterior chest twice daily (every 12 hours), as per medical guidance daily for 30 days.

groups.title: Verutex
groups.description: Participants received erlotinib 150 mg daily and a thin film of the topical formulation of Verutex was applied to face, neck, and anterior and posterior chest twice daily (every 12 hours), as per medical guidance daily for 30 days.

baselineCharacteristicsModule.populationDescription: Intention to treat (ITT) population covered all participants who had at least one application of study drug and who had at least one post-treatment assessment, irrespective of compliance extent with protocol criteria.

adverseEventsModule.timeFrame: Adverse Events were recorded from Day 0 to Day 45 (15 days after the End of study)

eventGroups.title: Fisiogel
eventGroups.description: Participants received erlotinib 150 mg daily and A thin film of the topical formulation of Fisiogel was applied to face, neck, and anterior and posterior chest twice daily (every 12 hours), as per medical guidance daily for 30 days.

seriousEvents.term: Fever (in the absence of neutropenia, where neurtropenia is defined as ANC <1.0x109/L)
Death not associated with CTCAE term
seriousEvents.organSystem: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

seriousEvents.term: Death not associated with CTCAE term - "cardiac arrest"
seriousEvents.organSystem: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

seriousEvents.term: Hemorrhage, pulmonary/upper respiratory, respiratory tract NOS

seriousEvents.organSystem: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

otherEvents.term: Death not associated with CTCAE term
otherEvents.organSystem: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certainAgreement.otherDetails: The study being conducted under this agreement is part of the overall study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the study, but after the first publication or presentation that involves the overall study. Sponsor may request that confidential information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor's intellectual property rights.
